summary: A dystopia where a totalitarian state rewrites truth and polices thought. Winston Smith rebels in small ways, searching for freedom and meaning under constant surveillance.

title: The Hobbit
summary: Homebody hobbit Bilbo joins dwarves on a quest to reclaim their treasure from the dragon Smaug. Along the road he discovers wit, bravery, and unlikely friends.

title: Brave New World
summary: A society engineered for stability uses conditioning and pleasure to suppress individuality. A few characters question what it means to be truly human.

title: Fahrenheit 451
summary: Fireman Montag burns books in a future that fears ideas. Meeting curious neighbors, he begins to question censorship and seeks knowledge and purpose.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
summary: Scout Finch grows up in the Jim Crow South while her father defends a Black man wrongly accused. The story explores empathy, courage, and moral growth.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
summary: Holden Caulfield wanders New York after leaving school, wrestling with grief, phoniness, and the loss of innocence.

title: The Name of the Wind
summary: Kvothe recounts his life—street urchin to gifted arcanist—seeking truth about mysterious beings and the myths surrounding his name.

title: The Alchemist
summary: Shepherd Santiago follows recurring dreams across deserts in search of treasure, learning to listen to omens and his heart.

title: The Little Prince
summary: A pilot crashes in the desert and meets a curious prince from a tiny planet. Simple encounters reveal tender truths about love and seeing with the heart.

title: Dune
summary: On the desert world Arrakis, Paul Atreides confronts betrayal, survival, and destiny amid spice-fueled politics and ecological struggle.

title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
summary: Four siblings discover Narnia, trapped in winter by a cruel witch. With Aslan, they learn about courage, sacrifice, and hope.
